page.para: The chil/dren are play/ing hide-and-seek. It is Ha/ri/ta’s turn to hide.
She hides a/mong the maize plants. Can you see her?
A/di/tya and Dee/ksha shout her name. Ha/ri/ta does not an/swer.
She does not make a sound. Not e/ven when an ant bites her foot!
But it is hot, and Ha/ri/ta feels sleep/y. Soon she is fast a/sleep.
When she wakes up, it is al/most dark. She is all a/lone.
Ha/ri/ta starts to cry. They have for/got/ten her!
Then she hears her dad. “Ha/ri/ta, Ha/ri/ta, where are you?” he calls.
“I am here, dad!” shouts Ha/ri/ta. And ver/y soon dad finds her.
“You are safe now,” says dad. Ha/ri/ta says noth/ing. She just cries and cries.
